H0.text: Electricity is the subject of Isaac Newton's study, which has led scientists today to understand how forces work.

H1.text: Magnetism is what scientists today understand how forces work due to Isaac Newton's study of.

H2.text: Atoms are what scientists today understand about how forces work, based on Isaac Newton's study of them.

H3.text: Gravity is the force that scientists today understand how forces work because of Isaac Newton's study of it.

A4.text: Newton's law of universal gravitation describes gravity as a force by stating that every particle attracts every other particle in the universe with a force that is proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between their centers of mass.

A5.text: The value of the constant G was first accurately determined from the results of the Cavendish experiment conducted by the British scientist Henry Cavendish in 1798.
